title: 820-4924 charging port burns down
message: Hey again, problem woth another messed board, everything works now exept chargin ports is burning down every time when i plug magsafe

title: 820-4924 charging port burns down
message:
Do you mean something gets burnt in the DCIN board?
Are you using original 60/85W Magsafe 2 charger?
The machine works good with battery, but doesn't start with charger alone?

title: 820-4924 charging port burns down
message: It starting with battery, it turns on but when i plug magsafe it burns charging port down

title: 820-4924 charging port burns down

title: 820-4924 charging port burns down
message:
Does it really burn charger port?
Do you see sparks, or smoke coming from DCIN board components?
Or just board turns off when charger is plugged in?

Post Q7010 voltages with charger alone, no battery.

title: 820-4924 charging port burns down
message: I see red burning and smoke everytime when i plug charg

title: 820-4924 charging port burns down
message:
Did you try different original chargers?

Be aware of using lab PSU.
Set 3V output and go to 16-18V AFTER connected to the board.

What component in DCIN board gets burnt?

title: 820-4924 charging port burns down
message: Dc board 3 legs got burnt

title: 820-4924 charging port burns down
message: Tryed different original chargers

title: 820-4924 charging port burns down
message:
That should be TVS diode connected to PP18V5_DCIN.
Does it happen with original new DCIN board?

That must be 24V diode.
If someone replaces it with one from ADAPTER_SENSE line, which is 5V, diode will get burnt instantly...

title: 820-4924 charging port burns down
message: Original dcin board

title: 820-4924 charging port burns down
message: Was some external device connected when you plugged in the charger?

title: 820-4924 charging port burns down
message: no , and f7005 burn down also everytime

title: 820-4924 charging port burns down
message:
You've didn't mention F7005 before, which was important.
That means the short is after fuse.
Check diode mode to ground there and be sure Q7180 is not shorted between input/otput pins.

title: 820-4924 charging port burns down
message: q7180 diode to ground shows 0

title: 820-4924 charging port burns down
message:
Which of its pins???
Remove it and see where the short to ground remains.

title: 820-4924 charging port burns down
message:
These pins have no external connection; did you remove Q7180?
Are you sure no short to ground at 1/2, or 4/5?

title: 820-4924 charging port burns down
message: Now charging port ok but every 3 charging it burns down F7005

title: 820-4924 charging port burns down
message:
I can only think you don't use original Magsafe 2 charger.
Fake magsafe charger delivers max voltage from the first moment; that could be 15-18V.
Original charger delivers only 3V in the first moment; nominal voltage appears after it correctly detected the board.

title: 820-4924 charging port burns down
message: Tryed lab psu and original 60w charger both same way.

title: 820-4924 charging port burns down
message: Remove F7005 and post voltage on its pad 1; with "original" charger.
